summary: Clifford A Fenton, Jr. was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications and reports that list Fenton's name, position, salary, and earnings during various periods from 1977 to 1978. These documents confirm Fenton's employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The specific role or responsibilities of Fenton within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Clifford A Fenton, Jr. was an employee of the HSCA, which investigated the JFK assassination. While the exact nature of his role is not specified in the provided documents, his employment with the committee places him within the context of the JFK assassination investigation.
